snippet: The decision, exempting dozens of doctors from a blanket ban in force for 15 years, is the latest in a series of steps to relax constraints on Palestinians entering Israel.
abstract: Israeli authorities say dozens of Palestinian doctors who work in Israel will be allowed to drive their own vehicles into country from West Bank; it is latest move to ease restrictions on Palestinians entering Israel.
lead_paragraph: The decision, exempting dozens of doctors from a blanket ban in force for 15 years, is the latest in a series of steps to relax constraints on Palestinians entering Israel.

headline.main: Palestinian Doctors Can Drive Own Vehicles Into Israel, Agency Says
headline.print_headline: West Bank Doctors Allowed to Enter Israel in Their Cars
